content.name: Full-Stack Developer
content.location: US Department of Navy (NAVSUP BSC), Mechanicsburg, PA
content.summary: Develop and maintain 3 large-scale US Navy web applications using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Oracle PL/SQL, and various JavaScript libraries (Bootstrap, DataTables, jQuery UI, etc.).
tasks: Led a major version release for an application with 2,000 users, delivering requirements one month ahead of schedule while iteratively soliciting client feedback, prioritizing requests, and delegating team tasks.
Architect and optimize relational database structures and queries for applications with 30+ tables and 10,000+ data points, enhancing performance and ensuring system scalability.
Leverage Agile development methodologies with weekly scrum meetings and daily Azure DevOps backlog management, ensuring timely progress on application features and bug investigations.
Maintain application compliance with evolving accessibility standards (Section 508 and WCAG 2.2).
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, project managers, and clients to identify and troubleshoot issues, improve system functionality, and update technical documentation.

content.name: Front-End Developer
content.location: Mercer County Library System, Lawrenceville, NJ
content.summary: Developed and maintained 250+ page website using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, PHP, MySQL, WordPress, WordPress plugins and custom-made WordPress child themes.
tasks: Executed a 2-year website overhaul by researching best practices, creating and presenting mock-ups, incorporating feedback, performing QA testing, launching, maintaining, and improving.
Implemented new “Curbside Pickup” feature during COVID-19, allowing users to request contact-free pick-up of materials during dedicated time slots, serving a daily average of 250 patrons.
Improved website performance by lazy-loading images, compressing files, minifying JavaScript/CSS, and increasing cache time.

Created a style guide in Adobe Illustrator to improve accessibility and strengthen brand identity, utilizing standardized logos, fonts, and WCAG 2.2-compliant color combinations (dark theme inclusive).
Coordinated with 180 staff members across 12 departments and 9 locations to curate website content and troubleshoot, maintain, and upgrade the hardware and software of 1,500 local devices.
Prepared comprehensive documentation covering 140 processes to facilitate emergency maintenance by non-technical staff and safeguard against a potential loss of institutional knowledge.

content.name: Master of Information
content.summary: Advanced expertise in database design, problem solving with data, and information organization.

content.name: Bachelor of Arts in Information Technology
content.summary: Developed a strong foundation in computer science, information management, and technical communication.
